gurmukhi: gurmuiK mn bc krm iekqR Bey prmdBuq giq AlK lKwey hY
transliteration: Gurmukhi Man Bach Karam Ikatr Bhaay , Paramadabhout Gati Alakh Lakhaaay Hai ?
translation: The obedient slaves of Guru, being dyed in the hue of Naam Simran (with their mind, speech and actions being harmonious) sees the astonishing and transcendental Lord God conspicuous.

gurmukhi: AMqr iDAwn idb joq ko audoqu BieE qiRBvn rUp Gt AMqir idKwey hY
transliteration: Antar Dhiaan Dib Jot Ko Udotu Bhaiao , Tribhavan Roop Ghat Antari Dikhaaay Hai ?
translation: And when he looks inward (concentrates his faculties within), he sees the divine light refulgent within. He sees the happenings of the three worlds in his consciousness.

gurmukhi: prm inDwn gur igAwn ko pRgwsu BieE gMimqw qiRkwl giq jqn jqwey hY
transliteration: Param Nidhaan Gur Giaan Ko Pragaasu Bhaiao , Ganmitaa Trikaal Gati Jatan Jataaay Hai ?
translation: When the supreme treasure of Guru's Gyan (Divine knowledge) becomes effulgent in the mind of a Guru conscious person, he becomes aware of all the three worlds. And even then, he does not go astray from his objective of absorption of self into the vastness

gurmukhi: Awqm qrMg pRym rs mD pwn mq AkQ kQw ibnod hyrq ihrwey hY ]64]
transliteration: Aatam Tarang Praym Ras Madh Paan Mata , Akad Kadaa Binod Hayrat Hiraaay Hai ?64?
translation: Such a devotee remains in a state of trance drinking deep the divine elixir of ecstasy. This wonderful state is beyond description. One feels amazed at this state. (64)
